page.title: 16Chlorination
page.content:
{CHLORINATION}
As surface waters are open to contamination by organic matter, sterilisation is necessary to kill off any bacteria which may be present. This is done by the addition of chlorine gas,facilities for which are available before or after filtration. As the chlorine demand for a surface water varies considerably, it is usual to add excess chlorine initially and to remove the excess with sulphur dioxide before the water enters the distribution system. The small chlorine residual leaving the treatment works is stabilised by the addition of ammonia.
